New Records: It was New Zealand's biggest ever T20 victory over Australia.
This is New Zealand's first win in any format in Australia since 2011.
It's Australia's heaviest defeat ever at a T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Finn Allen set the tone by smashing his second and third balls off Mitch Starc for four and six on his way to a 16-ball 42.
Devon Conway carried his bat for a 58-ball-92 as the Black Caps made 3-200.
Tim Southee finished with figures of 3-6 and Mitch Santner 3-31 from four overs.
Glenn Phillips took a stunning outfield catch to dismiss Marcus Stoinis.
David Warner was bowled after a delivery deflected off his glove, thigh and bat before miraculously deflecting onto the stumps.
Jimmy Neesham and Devon Conway took the total to 200 with a six from the final ball of the innings.
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Finch won the toss and chose to bowl.
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Maxwell: 'They played brilliantly. They got too many runs and we weren't able to get partnerships, all the way through the innings we kept losing wickets. It was basically how not to play a T20.'

Mitch Santner: 'It's obviously a tough place to win, we've found that over the years so, it was nice to fire some shots early tonight. It's obviously a long tournament, any team in this pool can upset anyone.'

Aaron Finch: 'They got the jump on us with the bat and we never really recovered. When you're chasing a big total it can come undone like that, and we were totally outplayed in all three facets. [Net run rate] took a hammering, didn't it? You've got to plan to win the next four games and get some luck on the way. But we have belief in our team to do that.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather or pitch conditions affecting the match: None mentioned.
Historical comparisons or records beyond match performance: None mentioned.
Notable head-to-head statistics or unique historical aspects: None mentioned.
